Bitcoin Core wallet does not treat addresses as holding individual balances
- that's just an interpretation, and it doesn't work well with the use of
random fresh change addresses. Instead, all addresses are seen as entry
points into the whole wallet, but after that, all funds are shared. If you
want to see the actual low-level state of your wallet, you can enable coin
control.

The idea to show received per address may make sense, I think.

I apparently need to learn a lot more about how the wallet works!
